scenarios.description:
Definition of scenarios for your VUs to run:
https://www.artillery.io/docs/reference/test-script#scenarios-section

weight.description:
Use this to specify that some scenarios should be picked more often than others.
https://www.artillery.io/docs/reference/test-script#scenario-weights
weight.title: Scenario weight

beforeScenario.description:
Custom Javascript functions to run before each scenario
https://www.artillery.io/docs/reference/engines/http#function-actions-and-beforescenario--afterscenario-hooks
beforeScenario.title: beforeScenario hook

afterScenario.description:
Custom Javascript functions to run after each scenario
https://www.artillery.io/docs/reference/engines/http#function-actions-and-beforescenario--afterscenario-hooks
afterScenario.title: afterScenario hook

beforeScenario.description:
Custom Javascript functions to run before each scenario
https://www.artillery.io/docs/reference/engines/http#function-actions-and-beforescenario--afterscenario-hooks
beforeScenario.title: beforeScenario hook

afterScenario.description:
Custom Javascript functions to run after each scenario
https://www.artillery.io/docs/reference/engines/http#function-actions-and-beforescenario--afterscenario-hooks
afterScenario.title: afterScenario hook

scenarios.title: Scenarios Section

before.description:
Optional scenario to run once per test before the main scenarios section (in distributed mode, it's once per worker).
https://www.artillery.io/docs/reference/test-script#before-and-after-sections
before.title: Before Section

after.description:
Optional scenario to run once per test after the main scenarios section (in distributed mode, it's once per worker).
https://www.artillery.io/docs/reference/test-script#before-and-after-sections
after.title: After Section

target.description:
Endpoint of the system under test, such as a hostname, IP address or a URI.
In Playwright tests, this will be used as the baseURL by default.

https://www.artillery.io/docs/reference/test-script#target---target-service
target.title: Target

phases.description:
A load phase defines how Artillery generates new virtual users (VUs) in a specified time period.
https://www.artillery.io/docs/reference/test-script#phases---load-phases

duration.description:
Test phase duration (in seconds).
Can also be any valid human-readable duration: https://www.npmjs.com/package/ms .
duration.title: Test Phase Duration

maxVusers.description: Cap the number of concurrent virtual users at any given time.
maxVusers.title: Maximum virtual users

arrivalRate.description:
Constant arrival rate - i.e. the number of virtual users generated every second.
https://www.artillery.io/docs/reference/test-script#constant-arrival-rate
arrivalRate.title: Arrival Rate

rampTo.description:
Ramp from initial arrivalRate to this value over time period.
https://www.artillery.io/docs/reference/test-script#ramp-up-rate
rampTo.title: Ramp up rate

duration.description:
Test phase duration (in seconds).
Can also be any valid human-readable duration: https://www.npmjs.com/package/ms .
duration.title: Test Phase Duration

maxVusers.description: Cap the number of concurrent virtual users at any given time.
maxVusers.title: Maximum virtual users

arrivalCount.description:
Fixed number of virtual users over that time period.
https://www.artillery.io/docs/reference/test-script#fixed-number-of-arrivals-per-second
arrivalCount.title: Arrival Count

pause.description:
Pause the test phase execution for given duration (in seconds).
Can also be any valid human-readable duration: https://www.npmjs.com/package/ms.
pause.title: Pause

phases.title: Phases

maxSockets.description:
Maximum amount of TCP connections per virtual user.
https://www.artillery.io/docs/reference/engines/http#max-sockets-per-virtual-user
maxSockets.title: Maximum Sockets

extendedMetrics.description:
Enable tracking of additional HTTP metrics.
https://www.artillery.io/docs/reference/engines/http#additional-performance-metrics
extendedMetrics.title: Enable Extended Metrics

headers.description:
Default headers to be used in all requests. Replace *. with your header name, and set string value.
https://www.artillery.io/docs/reference/engines/http#default-configuration
headers.title: Default Headers

cookie.description: Default cookies to be used in all requests. Replace *. with your cookie name, and set string value.
cookie.title: Default Cookies

strictCapture.description:
Whether to turn on strict capture by default for all captures.
https://www.artillery.io/docs/reference/engines/http#turn-off-strict-capture
strictCapture.title: Strict capture

jitter.description: Sets jitter to simulate real-world random variance into think time pauses. Accepts both number and percentage.

defaults.title: Configure Default Settings for all requests

socketio.description: For more information on supported options, visit https://socket.io/docs/v4/client-api/

query.description: Query parameters can be specified as a string or dictionary.
query.title: Query

extraHeaders.description:
Extra headers may be passed with this option. 
The extraHeaders option only works if the default polling transport is used. When using other transports, extra headers won't be taken into account by the server.
extraHeaders.title: Extra Headers

transports.description: You can skip long-polling by using the transports option to specify WebSocket transport.
transports.title: Websocket Transports only

socketio.title: SocketIo Configuration

processor.description:
Path to a CommonJS (.js), ESM (.mjs) or Typescript (.ts) module to load for this test run.
https://www.artillery.io/docs/reference/test-script#processor---custom-js-code
processor.title: Processor Function Path

variables.description: Map of variables to expose to the test run.
variables.title: Variables

payload.description:
Load data from CSV to be used during the test run:
https://www.artillery.io/docs/reference/test-script#payload---loading-data-from-csv-files

fields.description: List of names of fields to be used in the test to load the data
fields.title: CSV Fields

order.description: Controls how the CSV rows are selected for each virtual user.
order.title: Order

skipHeader.description: Set to `true` to make Artillery skip the first row in the CSV file (typically the header row)
skipHeader.title: Skip Header?

delimiter.description: Custom delimiter character to use in the payload.
delimiter.title: Delimiter

cast.description: Controls whether Artillery converts fields to native types (e.g. numbers or booleans). To keep those fields as strings, set this option to `false`.
cast.title: Cast?

skipEmptyLines.description: Controls whether Artillery should skip empty lines in the payload.
skipEmptyLines.title: Skip empty lines?

loadAll.description: Set loadAll to true to provide all rows to each VU
loadAll.title: Load all data

name.description: Name of loadAll data
name.title: Data Name

fields.title: CSV Fields

order.title: Order

rejectUnauthorized.title: Set this setting to `false` to tell Artillery to accept self-signed TLS certificates.

bundling.description: Configuration for bundling the test script and its dependencies

external.description:
Can be used when using Typescript (.ts) processors. List npm modules to prevent them from being bundled. Use in case there are issues with bundling certain packages.
https://www.artillery.io/docs/reference/test-script#preventing-bundling-of-typescript-packages
external.title: External Packages

bundling.title: Bundling

plugins.description: List of Artillery plugins to use (official or third-party) and their configuration

reportFailuresAsErrors.description: Reports failures from expect plugin as errors in Artillery Report
reportFailuresAsErrors.title: Report Failures as Errors

useOnlyRequestNames.description: Use request name instead of the URL path when logging requests in console and report
useOnlyRequestNames.title: Use Only Request Names

expectDefault200.description: Sets a 200 OK status code expectation for all requests.
expectDefault200.title: Expect 200 by default

thresholds.description:
Ensure that a metric is under some threshold value.
https://www.artillery.io/docs/reference/extensions/ensure#threshold-checks
thresholds.title: Threshold Checks

conditions.description:
Set more complex expressions for additional checks.
https://www.artillery.io/docs/reference/extensions/ensure#advanced-conditional-checks
conditions.title: Conditional Checks

metrics-by-endpoint.description:
Visualise metrics per endpoint visited during your HTTP test. Docs: https://www.artillery.io/docs/reference/extensions/metrics-by-endpoint
Note: this plugin is enabled by default, and will display per endpoint metrics in the report. If you want to see them in the console, enable it manually.

useOnlyRequestNames.description: Use request name property as endpoint name instead of the full URL. Recommended for dynamic URLs.
useOnlyRequestNames.title: Use Only Request Names

stripQueryString.description: Strip query strings from the endpoint name automatically.
stripQueryString.title: Strip Query String

ignoreUnnamedRequests.description: Ignore per-endpoint metrics for requests without a name property set.
ignoreUnnamedRequests.title: Ignore Unnamed Requests

metricsNamespace.description: Custom prefix to use for metrics published by this plugin.
metricsNamespace.title: Metrics Namespace

metrics-by-endpoint.title: Metrics by Endpoint Plugin

fake-data.description:

fake-data.title: Fake Data Plugin

plugins.title: Plugins

aggregateByName.description:
Aggregate Artillery metrics by test scenario name.
https://www.artillery.io/docs/reference/engines/playwright#aggregate-metrics-by-scenario-name
aggregateByName.title: Aggregate by name

defaultTimeout.description:
Default maximum time (in seconds) for all Playwright methods accepting the `timeout` option.
https://playwright.dev/docs/api/class-browsercontext#browser-context-set-default-timeout
defaultTimeout.title: Default timeout

defaultNavigationTimeout.description:
Default maximum navigation time (in seconds) for Playwright navigation methods, like `page.goto()`.
https://playwright.dev/docs/api/class-browsercontext#browser-context-set-default-navigation-timeout
defaultNavigationTimeout.title: Default navigation timeout

testIdAttribute.description:
When set, changes the attribute used by locator `page.getByTestId` in Playwright. 
 https://playwright.dev/docs/api/class-framelocator#frame-locator-get-by-test-id
testIdAttribute.title: Test ID Attribute

extendedMetrics.description:
If enabled, Artillery will collect additional metrics from Playwright.
Check more information here: https://www.artillery.io/docs/reference/engines/playwright#extended-metrics
extendedMetrics.title: Playwright Extended Metrics

showAllPageMetrics.description:
If enabled, Artillery will collect Web Vitals for all pages, rather than just ones that start with target URL.
Check more information here: https://www.artillery.io/docs/reference/engines/playwright#show-web-vital-metrics-for-all-pages
showAllPageMetrics.title: Web Vitals on all Pages

launchOptions.description:
Arguments for the `browser.launch()` call in Playwright.
https://playwright.dev/docs/api/class-browsertype#browser-type-launch
launchOptions.title: Playwright launch options

contextOptions.description:
Arguments for the `browser.newContext()` call in Playwright.
https://playwright.dev/docs/api/class-browser#browser-new-context
contextOptions.title: Playwright context options

useSeparateBrowserPerVU.description:
If enabled, a new browser process will be created for each VU. By default Artillery uses new browser contexts for new VUs.
WARNING: Using this option is discouraged as it will increase CPU/memory usage of your tests.
https://www.artillery.io/docs/reference/engines/playwright#configuration
useSeparateBrowserPerVU.title: Use a separate browser process for each VU

thresholds.description:
Ensure that a metric is under some threshold value.
https://www.artillery.io/docs/reference/extensions/ensure#threshold-checks
thresholds.title: Threshold Checks

conditions.description:
Set more complex expressions for additional checks.
https://www.artillery.io/docs/reference/extensions/ensure#advanced-conditional-checks
conditions.title: Conditional Checks

environments.description:
Replace /.*/ with the name of an environment to run your load test against different configs:
https://www.artillery.io/docs/reference/test-script#environments---config-profiles

target.description:
Endpoint of the system under test, such as a hostname, IP address or a URI.
In Playwright tests, this will be used as the baseURL by default.

https://www.artillery.io/docs/reference/test-script#target---target-service
target.title: Target

phases.description:
A load phase defines how Artillery generates new virtual users (VUs) in a specified time period.
https://www.artillery.io/docs/reference/test-script#phases---load-phases

duration.description:
Test phase duration (in seconds).
Can also be any valid human-readable duration: https://www.npmjs.com/package/ms .
duration.title: Test Phase Duration

maxVusers.description: Cap the number of concurrent virtual users at any given time.
maxVusers.title: Maximum virtual users

arrivalRate.description:
Constant arrival rate - i.e. the number of virtual users generated every second.
https://www.artillery.io/docs/reference/test-script#constant-arrival-rate
arrivalRate.title: Arrival Rate

rampTo.description:
Ramp from initial arrivalRate to this value over time period.
https://www.artillery.io/docs/reference/test-script#ramp-up-rate
rampTo.title: Ramp up rate

duration.description:
Test phase duration (in seconds).
Can also be any valid human-readable duration: https://www.npmjs.com/package/ms .
duration.title: Test Phase Duration

maxVusers.description: Cap the number of concurrent virtual users at any given time.
maxVusers.title: Maximum virtual users

arrivalCount.description:
Fixed number of virtual users over that time period.
https://www.artillery.io/docs/reference/test-script#fixed-number-of-arrivals-per-second
arrivalCount.title: Arrival Count

pause.description:
Pause the test phase execution for given duration (in seconds).
Can also be any valid human-readable duration: https://www.npmjs.com/package/ms.
pause.title: Pause

phases.title: Phases

maxSockets.description:
Maximum amount of TCP connections per virtual user.
https://www.artillery.io/docs/reference/engines/http#max-sockets-per-virtual-user
maxSockets.title: Maximum Sockets

extendedMetrics.description:
Enable tracking of additional HTTP metrics.
https://www.artillery.io/docs/reference/engines/http#additional-performance-metrics
extendedMetrics.title: Enable Extended Metrics

headers.description:
Default headers to be used in all requests. Replace *. with your header name, and set string value.
https://www.artillery.io/docs/reference/engines/http#default-configuration
headers.title: Default Headers

cookie.description: Default cookies to be used in all requests. Replace *. with your cookie name, and set string value.
cookie.title: Default Cookies

strictCapture.description:
Whether to turn on strict capture by default for all captures.
https://www.artillery.io/docs/reference/engines/http#turn-off-strict-capture
strictCapture.title: Strict capture

jitter.description: Sets jitter to simulate real-world random variance into think time pauses. Accepts both number and percentage.

defaults.title: Configure Default Settings for all requests

socketio.description: For more information on supported options, visit https://socket.io/docs/v4/client-api/

query.description: Query parameters can be specified as a string or dictionary.
query.title: Query

extraHeaders.description:
Extra headers may be passed with this option. 
The extraHeaders option only works if the default polling transport is used. When using other transports, extra headers won't be taken into account by the server.
extraHeaders.title: Extra Headers

transports.description: You can skip long-polling by using the transports option to specify WebSocket transport.
transports.title: Websocket Transports only

socketio.title: SocketIo Configuration

processor.description:
Path to a CommonJS (.js), ESM (.mjs) or Typescript (.ts) module to load for this test run.
https://www.artillery.io/docs/reference/test-script#processor---custom-js-code
processor.title: Processor Function Path

variables.description: Map of variables to expose to the test run.
variables.title: Variables

payload.description:
Load data from CSV to be used during the test run:
https://www.artillery.io/docs/reference/test-script#payload---loading-data-from-csv-files

fields.description: List of names of fields to be used in the test to load the data
fields.title: CSV Fields

order.description: Controls how the CSV rows are selected for each virtual user.
order.title: Order

skipHeader.description: Set to `true` to make Artillery skip the first row in the CSV file (typically the header row)
skipHeader.title: Skip Header?

delimiter.description: Custom delimiter character to use in the payload.
delimiter.title: Delimiter

bundling.description: Configuration for bundling the test script and its dependencies

external.description:
Can be used when using Typescript (.ts) processors. List npm modules to prevent them from being bundled. Use in case there are issues with bundling certain packages.
https://www.artillery.io/docs/reference/test-script#preventing-bundling-of-typescript-packages
external.title: External Packages

bundling.title: Bundling

plugins.description: List of Artillery plugins to use (official or third-party) and their configuration

reportFailuresAsErrors.description: Reports failures from expect plugin as errors in Artillery Report
reportFailuresAsErrors.title: Report Failures as Errors

useOnlyRequestNames.description: Use request name instead of the URL path when logging requests in console and report
useOnlyRequestNames.title: Use Only Request Names

expectDefault200.description: Sets a 200 OK status code expectation for all requests.
expectDefault200.title: Expect 200 by default

thresholds.description:
Ensure that a metric is under some threshold value.
https://www.artillery.io/docs/reference/extensions/ensure#threshold-checks
thresholds.title: Threshold Checks

conditions.description:
Set more complex expressions for additional checks.
https://www.artillery.io/docs/reference/extensions/ensure#advanced-conditional-checks
conditions.title: Conditional Checks

metrics-by-endpoint.description:
Visualise metrics per endpoint visited during your HTTP test. Docs: https://www.artillery.io/docs/reference/extensions/metrics-by-endpoint
Note: this plugin is enabled by default, and will display per endpoint metrics in the report. If you want to see them in the console, enable it manually.

useOnlyRequestNames.description: Use request name property as endpoint name instead of the full URL. Recommended for dynamic URLs.
useOnlyRequestNames.title: Use Only Request Names

stripQueryString.description: Strip query strings from the endpoint name automatically.
stripQueryString.title: Strip Query String

ignoreUnnamedRequests.description: Ignore per-endpoint metrics for requests without a name property set.
ignoreUnnamedRequests.title: Ignore Unnamed Requests

metricsNamespace.description: Custom prefix to use for metrics published by this plugin.
metricsNamespace.title: Metrics Namespace

metrics-by-endpoint.title: Metrics by Endpoint Plugin

plugins.title: Plugins

aggregateByName.description:
Aggregate Artillery metrics by test scenario name.
https://www.artillery.io/docs/reference/engines/playwright#aggregate-metrics-by-scenario-name
aggregateByName.title: Aggregate by name

defaultTimeout.description:
Default maximum time (in seconds) for all Playwright methods accepting the `timeout` option.
https://playwright.dev/docs/api/class-browsercontext#browser-context-set-default-timeout
defaultTimeout.title: Default timeout

defaultNavigationTimeout.description:
Default maximum navigation time (in seconds) for Playwright navigation methods, like `page.goto()`.
https://playwright.dev/docs/api/class-browsercontext#browser-context-set-default-navigation-timeout
defaultNavigationTimeout.title: Default navigation timeout

testIdAttribute.description:
When set, changes the attribute used by locator `page.getByTestId` in Playwright. 
 https://playwright.dev/docs/api/class-framelocator#frame-locator-get-by-test-id
testIdAttribute.title: Test ID Attribute

extendedMetrics.description:
If enabled, Artillery will collect additional metrics from Playwright.
Check more information here: https://www.artillery.io/docs/reference/engines/playwright#extended-metrics
extendedMetrics.title: Playwright Extended Metrics

showAllPageMetrics.description:
If enabled, Artillery will collect Web Vitals for all pages, rather than just ones that start with target URL.
Check more information here: https://www.artillery.io/docs/reference/engines/playwright#show-web-vital-metrics-for-all-pages
showAllPageMetrics.title: Web Vitals on all Pages

launchOptions.description:
Arguments for the `browser.launch()` call in Playwright.
https://playwright.dev/docs/api/class-browsertype#browser-type-launch
launchOptions.title: Playwright launch options

contextOptions.description:
Arguments for the `browser.newContext()` call in Playwright.
https://playwright.dev/docs/api/class-browser#browser-new-context
contextOptions.title: Playwright context options

useSeparateBrowserPerVU.description:
If enabled, a new browser process will be created for each VU. By default Artillery uses new browser contexts for new VUs.
WARNING: Using this option is discouraged as it will increase CPU/memory usage of your tests.
https://www.artillery.io/docs/reference/engines/playwright#configuration
useSeparateBrowserPerVU.title: Use a separate browser process for each VU

thresholds.description:
Ensure that a metric is under some threshold value.
https://www.artillery.io/docs/reference/extensions/ensure#threshold-checks
thresholds.title: Threshold Checks

conditions.description:
Set more complex expressions for additional checks.
https://www.artillery.io/docs/reference/extensions/ensure#advanced-conditional-checks
conditions.title: Conditional Checks

target.description:
Endpoint of the system under test, such as a hostname, IP address or a URI.
In Playwright tests, this will be used as the baseURL by default.

https://www.artillery.io/docs/reference/test-script#target---target-service
target.title: Target

phases.description:
A load phase defines how Artillery generates new virtual users (VUs) in a specified time period.
https://www.artillery.io/docs/reference/test-script#phases---load-phases

duration.description:
Test phase duration (in seconds).
Can also be any valid human-readable duration: https://www.npmjs.com/package/ms .
duration.title: Test Phase Duration

maxVusers.description: Cap the number of concurrent virtual users at any given time.
maxVusers.title: Maximum virtual users

arrivalRate.description:
Constant arrival rate - i.e. the number of virtual users generated every second.
https://www.artillery.io/docs/reference/test-script#constant-arrival-rate
arrivalRate.title: Arrival Rate

rampTo.description:
Ramp from initial arrivalRate to this value over time period.
https://www.artillery.io/docs/reference/test-script#ramp-up-rate
rampTo.title: Ramp up rate

duration.description:
Test phase duration (in seconds).
Can also be any valid human-readable duration: https://www.npmjs.com/package/ms .
duration.title: Test Phase Duration

maxVusers.description: Cap the number of concurrent virtual users at any given time.
maxVusers.title: Maximum virtual users

arrivalCount.description:
Fixed number of virtual users over that time period.
https://www.artillery.io/docs/reference/test-script#fixed-number-of-arrivals-per-second
arrivalCount.title: Arrival Count

pause.description:
Pause the test phase execution for given duration (in seconds).
Can also be any valid human-readable duration: https://www.npmjs.com/package/ms.
pause.title: Pause

phases.title: Phases

maxSockets.description:
Maximum amount of TCP connections per virtual user.
https://www.artillery.io/docs/reference/engines/http#max-sockets-per-virtual-user
maxSockets.title: Maximum Sockets

extendedMetrics.description:
Enable tracking of additional HTTP metrics.
https://www.artillery.io/docs/reference/engines/http#additional-performance-metrics
extendedMetrics.title: Enable Extended Metrics

headers.description:
Default headers to be used in all requests. Replace *. with your header name, and set string value.
https://www.artillery.io/docs/reference/engines/http#default-configuration
headers.title: Default Headers

cookie.description: Default cookies to be used in all requests. Replace *. with your cookie name, and set string value.
cookie.title: Default Cookies

strictCapture.description:
Whether to turn on strict capture by default for all captures.
https://www.artillery.io/docs/reference/engines/http#turn-off-strict-capture
strictCapture.title: Strict capture

jitter.description: Sets jitter to simulate real-world random variance into think time pauses. Accepts both number and percentage.

defaults.title: Configure Default Settings for all requests

socketio.description: For more information on supported options, visit https://socket.io/docs/v4/client-api/

query.description: Query parameters can be specified as a string or dictionary.
query.title: Query

extraHeaders.description:
Extra headers may be passed with this option. 
The extraHeaders option only works if the default polling transport is used. When using other transports, extra headers won't be taken into account by the server.
extraHeaders.title: Extra Headers

transports.description: You can skip long-polling by using the transports option to specify WebSocket transport.
transports.title: Websocket Transports only

socketio.title: SocketIo Configuration

processor.description:
Path to a CommonJS (.js), ESM (.mjs) or Typescript (.ts) module to load for this test run.
https://www.artillery.io/docs/reference/test-script#processor---custom-js-code
processor.title: Processor Function Path

variables.description: Map of variables to expose to the test run.
variables.title: Variables

payload.description:
Load data from CSV to be used during the test run:
https://www.artillery.io/docs/reference/test-script#payload---loading-data-from-csv-files

fields.description: List of names of fields to be used in the test to load the data
fields.title: CSV Fields

order.description: Controls how the CSV rows are selected for each virtual user.
order.title: Order

skipHeader.description: Set to `true` to make Artillery skip the first row in the CSV file (typically the header row)
skipHeader.title: Skip Header?

delimiter.description: Custom delimiter character to use in the payload.
delimiter.title: Delimiter

cast.description: Controls whether Artillery converts fields to native types (e.g. numbers or booleans). To keep those fields as strings, set this option to `false`.
cast.title: Cast?

skipEmptyLines.description: Controls whether Artillery should skip empty lines in the payload.
skipEmptyLines.title: Skip empty lines?

loadAll.description: Set loadAll to true to provide all rows to each VU
loadAll.title: Load all data

metrics-by-endpoint.description:
Visualise metrics per endpoint visited during your HTTP test. Docs: https://www.artillery.io/docs/reference/extensions/metrics-by-endpoint
Note: this plugin is enabled by default, and will display per endpoint metrics in the report. If you want to see them in the console, enable it manually.

useOnlyRequestNames.title: Use Only Request Names

stripQueryString.description: Strip query strings from the endpoint name automatically.

ignoreUnnamedRequests.description: Ignore per-endpoint metrics for requests without a name property set.

metricsNamespace.description: Custom prefix to use for metrics published by this plugin.

metrics-by-endpoint.title: Metrics by Endpoint Plugin

cdnHit.description:
Check the presence of a cache hit/miss header from a CDN.
https://www.artillery.io/docs/reference/extensions/expect#cdnhit
cdnHit.title: Expectation: Is CDN Hit

statusCode.description:
Check the response status code.
If a list of status codes is provided, check that the response status code is present in the list.
https://www.artillery.io/docs/reference/extensions/expect#statuscode
statusCode.title: Expectation: Status Code

notStatusCode.description:
Check the response status code does not equal given status code.
If a list of status codes is provided, check that the response status code is not present in the list.
https://www.artillery.io/docs/reference/extensions/expect#notstatuscode
notStatusCode.title: Expectation: Not Status Code

contentType.description:
Check that the value of the `Content-Type` response header.
https://www.artillery.io/docs/reference/extensions/expect#contenttype
contentType.title: Expectation: Content type

hasProperty.description:
Check that the response object has the given property.

hasProperty.title: Expectation: Has Property

notHasProperty.description:
Check that the response object doesn't have the given property.
https://www.artillery.io/docs/reference/extensions/expect#hasproperty-and-nothasproperty
notHasProperty.title: Expectation: Not Has Property
